cs.GT, cs.MA, cs.DS, cs.EC, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with revenue maximization in a monopoly setting, which is a classic topic in game theory and economics. The use of duality and optimal transportation maps suggests a connection to convex optimization and mathematical programming, which are often studied in the cs.GT (Game Theory) and cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems) sub-categories. The paper also discusses stochastic dominance conditions and type distributions, which are common concepts in decision theory and statistics, and may be relevant to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-categories. Finally, the paper provides a general characterization result for optimal mechanisms, which could be of interest to researchers in the cs.EC (Economics and Computation) sub-category.
